snippet: With ambitions for live broadcasting and programming, AOL bought Adap.tv for $405 million, more than it paid for The Huffington Post.
abstract: AOL reports second-quarter revenue of $541 million, up 2 percent from year-earlier period; also announces acquisition of video advertising company Adap.tv for $405 million.

byline.original: By LESLIE KAUFMAN and MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: With ambitions for live broadcasting and programming, AOL bought Adap.tv for $405 million, more than it paid for The Huffington Post.

headline.main: AOL Posts Higher Revenue and Buys Company
headline.print_headline: AOL Posts Higher Revenue and Buys Company
